programme.title: Amanpour: Halla Tomasdottir & Pamela Hogan; Gayle Young; Cory Doctorow
programme.desc: Christiane speaks with Iceland's President Halla Tomasdottir and film director Pamela Hogan about the day 50 years ago when Iceland's women went on strike to demand equal treatment, and the recent documentary telling the full story. programme.title: Inside...: Inside the Center of Islamic Civilization
programme.desc: The Center for Islamic Civilization in Tashkent stands at the intersection of culture, history, and faith. It's a place where Uzbekistan's rich intellectual and artistic heritage meets the possibilities of the future. Through conversations with scholars, curators, and craftspeople, we see how an idea conceived nearly a decade ago has grown into a national center dedicated to rediscovering the spirit of the Islamic Golden Age. programme.desc: In 1997, thousands of people across Phoenix witness a series of lights unlike anything they've ever seen. Could this be one of the largest-scale UFO sightings in history, or is there another explanation?

programme.title: Hazardous History With Henry Winkler (S1)
programme.desc: Welcome to the unreal truth about everyday products of the past that were way more dangerous than meets the unsuspecting eye. Sensational items like mail-order dynamite and radioactive dishes.

programme.title: Pawn Stars (S23)
programme.desc: Lace up your cleats and charge the field with the Pawn Stars as they show blitz and try to score some of the greatest touchdown deals ever to pass through the shop.

programme.title: Mountain Men (S12)
programme.desc: Paul prepares his haul of winter fur for market and explores a new piece of land to call his own. Eustace builds a boat lift using massive logs and a block and tackle pulley.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries (S4)
programme.desc: They've been called the world's greatest archaeological enigma. 2,000-year-old geoglyphs made in the Peruvian desert that span over 50 miles. The drawings are so massive, they can be seen from the air.

programme.title: Holy Marvels With Dennis Quaid (S2)
programme.desc: Legendary beasts are believed to roam the earth, terrorising, killing, and even possessing humans. But are these creatures merely metaphors or is there proof they've actually been unleashed to wreak havoc?

programme.title: Dark Marvels
programme.desc: From the world's largest trebuchet to Nazi super cannons, these are the deadly weapons that rain destruction and spread fear on the battlefield.

programme.title: The Death Coast
programme.desc: After finding an American coin at Le Chameau's wreck site, Jeff MacKinnon must choose to either—stay the course or chase a new mystery.

programme.title: How Disney Built America
programme.desc: For nearly 70 years, Disney has pushed the boundaries of art and science through the work of a team of dreamers, designers, and builders known as the Imagineers.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens (S16)

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island (S11)

programme.title: History's Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman (S2)
programme.desc: A lifelong escape artist, Forrest Tucker, ends up in San Quentin prison. But despite his advanced age, he manages to engineer one of the most audacious prison breaks of all time.

programme.title: Hazardous History With Henry Winkler (S1)
programme.desc: The modern concept of 'extreme sports' is a product of marketing, but back in the old days, the rules of our nation's sports made them truly extreme. From bone-crushing football to deadly baseball games.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner (S3)
programme.desc: Today, human civilisation spans the globe, and there are more than 7 billion people on Earth. But how did humanity evolve? Were there other kinds of human-like creatures?

programme.desc: Humans can survive catastrophic injuries and deadly scenarios that defy the odds in ways that are inexplicable. Is cheating death when survival is seemingly impossible simply fate or good fortune?(n)

programme.title: The UnBelievable With Dan Aykroyd (S2)
programme.desc: We've heard the tales of great wars fought with groundbreaking weaponry, but what about everything else in between? Like missiles manned by pigeons to a helmet outfitted with firearms.(n)

programme.title: The UnBelievable With Dan Aykroyd (S2)
programme.desc: Some of the world's most valiant figures overcome the most treacherous and downright bizarre circumstances. Like a man who survives the apocalypse, or a woman involved in three maritime disasters.(n)

programme.title: The Mega-Brands That Built The World (S2)
programme.desc: A game designer named Steve Jobs starts a personal computer company in his parents' garage on his way to bringing computers mainstream.(n)

programme.title: Rare Survivors - China's Iconic Wildlife (S1)
programme.desc: Mist swirls around the base of Shanghai's skyline. From the city, tigers and monkeys seem as unreal and distant as dragons and mermaids emerging through the mist. Yet they exist as rare survivors in an extraordinary and diverse landscape. From snow leopards to wild horses, and from alligators to elephants, China's iconic wildlife is a lot more than just pandas.(n)

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: My Street Piano
programme.desc: Shibuya is one of Tokyo's largest cities. A piano is placed near a ticket gate at the station, and people stop to play from their heart.

programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.desc: A farm brings together people with something in common: fear of developing dementia. As they engage in planting and harvesting, staff members observe their actions and help them find a way forward.

programme.title: Satoyama Kitchen Fall
programme.desc: At the Satoyama Kitchen guesthouse in Hida Takayama, chef Nobuko, her cameraman husband Makoto and their cat Tama take us on a tasty journey of local cuisine served with a side of seasonal scenery.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.

programme.title: Herbal Symphony
programme.desc: In Uda, discover Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden, where the natural landscape from 300 years ago is preserved in a botanical time capsule, a sanctuary of the local culture and history.

programme.title: Activate Your Japanese!
programme.desc: Learn how to make the most of your Japanese skills. Watch our drama that features useful communication strategies, our snappy videos about onomatopoeia, and our documentaries on "senpai" in Japan.

programme.title: Culture Crossroads - BOSAI: Be Prepared
programme.desc: The fact that Japan is very dry in winter greatly increases the risk of fire. We learn tips for preventing fires occurring and how to respond effectively when a fire breaks out.

programme.title: HELLO! NHK WORLD-JAPAN
programme.desc: "IMPACTS" uses science and data to convey the reality of climate change. A November series-coinciding with the COP30 summit in Brazil-featured five COP-related shows and an Amazon rainforest special.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: BIZ STREAM SPECIAL EDITION
programme.desc: Beyond Space - Combining Storage with New Services: From hotels to multi-purpose lockers, this episode features innovative storage-based business models.

programme.title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords - Famous Masterpieces
programme.desc: Japanese swords, admired since ancient times for their beauty, are amazing works of art. This time, one of the "five greatest swords under heaven": Mikazuki Munechika.

programme.title: Direct Talk #176
programme.desc: Enami Noriyuki won the coveted Double Gold Award at the world's most prestigious marmalade-making competition in 2020 and 2022. He talks about the secrets of his craft and his tumultuous journey.

programme.title: The Seasons of Yamato
programme.desc: A series of poetic videos by Koichi Hozan, a videographer living in Nara, in collaboration with a pianist, Mine Kawakami, for which she plays exclusive pieces, makes you experience each seasons.

programme.title: MICE MEDIA
programme.desc: After a major earthquake hits, the father posts a video online spreading a rumor that the quake was "man-made." Of course, this earns a scolding from his daughter, but like always, not much changes.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Bustling Scenes of Old Tokyo(1)
programme.desc: Discover story behind the "36 Views of Mt. Fuji" woodprint series; "The Great Wave off Kanagawa" by Hokusai. It is not just a huge wave and Mt. Fuji, the boat caught in the wave have a reason.

programme.title: Today's Close-Up
programme.desc: Dig deeper into current affairs. Cutting-edge information and critical analysis on important issues confronting Japanese lives.

programme.title: Seasoning the Seasons
programme.desc: This program visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.

programme.desc: Time and Tide transcends time to detail extraordinary historical events in Japan and the world. Join NHK WORLD-JAPAN on a journey that reveals the truth behind some of the turning points of the past.(n)

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode looks at words related to a play and acting. Explore the unique culture behind them.(n)

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: At the Niihama Taiko Matsuri, teams of around 150 people carry taikodai: three-tonne parade floats housing a huge taiko drum. They compete to give the most powerful synchronized performance.(n)

programme.title: BOSAI:Science that Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: Japan's snow is a big draw for tourists, but snow and ice can also pose dangers to drivers. We'll look at some Japanese technology being developed to prevent whiteouts and accidents on slippery roads.(n)

programme.desc: Miyanaga Aiko (Contemporary artist) visits Kyoto. The Mincho font, drawn by hand in around 1990, evokes 350-year-old hand-carved woodblocks, made to print Buddhist sutras.(n)

programme.desc: After an American high school student loses his life in a mass shooting, his parents use AI to create an avatar of him, both to speak out against gun violence and to help them recover from the trauma.(n)

programme.title: Darwin's Amazing Animals
programme.desc: Thailand's Asian openbill storks have no time to feel squeamish about their daily diet. After all, their beaks must move with deft precision to extract the soft flesh inside...of 200 snails each!(n)

programme.title: Time-lapse Journey
programme.desc: Kyoto in the autumn: the old capital is even more beautiful when dressed in fall colors. Witness the contemplative and quiet beauty of Kyoto through time-lapse photography.(n)

programme.title: Let's Enjoy MATH with Barky the Dog
programme.desc: Numbler erases a part of a cake delivery memo, resulting in the delivery of four cakes instead of one. Barky solves the mystery by showing the difference between ordinal numbers and cardinal numbers.(n)

programme.title: TAKE TECH
programme.desc: A program for upper primary to lower secondary school children to explore the everyday technologies all around them. Each episode takes a piece of familiar tech to find out what it does and how.(n)
